required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Massage and Cold Water Immersion on Movement Variability an Muscle Tone of Swimmers
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Post Exercise Massage and Cold-water Immersion on Movement Variability and Muscle Stiffness in Swimmers: A Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Training prescription is planned considering recovery periods to enhance performance. To assess recovery, a complexity model can be used, in which the main variable would correspond to a fractal of performance. To assess the effectiveness of post-exercise massage and cold-water immersion under a new prism of recovery by means of muscle stiffness and movement variability analysis regarding the sport-specific gesture and an experimental task of shoulder elevation in swimmers.

detailed_description.textblock: Fifty swimmers from São Paulo state swimming teams will be initially assessed to investigate movement patterns at rest and after a fatigue protocol by means of inertial sensors. The participants will be assessed regarding their perceptions by the Swimmer's Perception of Effort Questionnaire (SPEQ), muscle stiffness by a myotonometer, skin temperature by a thermographic infrared camera and coordination by the Coordination Index and Continuous Relative Phase (CRP). Then, the athletes will perform the fatigue protocol again followed by five interventions in a crossover design separated by 24hr: i) superficial massage, ii) deep massage iii) cold-water immersion iv) immersion in thermoneutral water and v) control (no intervention). All procedures will be performed for an experimental task of shoulder elevation and the sport-specific gesture (front crawl simulation in swim bench). The statistical analysis will be conducted in SPSS software. To analyze fractal properties of time series the detrended fluctuation analysis (DFA) will be used where (α) varies from 0,5 to 1,5, interpreted as random series and Brownian noise, respectively. To compared pre and post assessments from initial testing the paired t test will be used. To compare perceptions, muscle stiffness and temperature between groups after fatigue protocol and intervention a Mixed ANOVA will be used with Greenhouse-Geisser corrections and Bonferroni post-hoc if necessary. Descriptive data will be presented as mean and standard deviations. All analysis will assume level of significance of P< 0,05.

primary_outcome.description: Four inertial sensors (XSens) will be positioned over the sternum, scapula, humerus and forearm on the dominant side. Data from the sensors will be extracted and processed with non linear analysis to determine the variability of the movement pattern

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline swimmer's Perception of Effort Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: questionnaire that evaluates the athletes' perceptions during a race (well, heavy, tired, discomfort, pain, disengaged / uncoordinated, caught, burning, shortness of breath and fast heart) rated from 1 to 5 (nothing, little, moderate, a lot and extremely)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Perception of Effort
secondary_outcome.description: The modified Borg scale (CR10) ranging from 0 (nothing) to 10 (extremely strong) will be used

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Continuous Relative Phase
secondary_outcome.description: subtraction of the phase angle of the left and right shoulders and classified according to three coordinating modes ranging from 0 to 360 °, they are: i) in phase (0 ± 30 °), antiphase (180 ± 30 °) and outside phase (30 ° <CRP <150 ° and 210 ° <CRP <330 °
movement of the arms during the frontal swim according to three models: i) opposition, ii) recovery and overlap

The MyotonPRO probe will be placed perpendicular to the skin surface on the muscle belly previously marked with a pen by the evaluator at 1: Deltoid; 2: Pectoralis Major; 3: Biceps brachii; 4: Femoral Rectum; 5: Upper Trapezius; 6: Lumbar multifidus; 7: Triceps; 8: Biceps Femoris
The temperature will be measured using an infrared thermographic camera, at the same points of myotonometry

arm_group.arm_group_label: Deep massage and Cold water immersion
Superficial Massage and Water immersion in room temperature

intervention.description: The intervention group will receive 12 minutes of massage on the legs, arms and the back with three different sliding pressures.
intervention.arm_group_label: Deep massage and Cold water immersion

intervention.description: The comparator group will receive 12 minutes of only one sliding pressure The superficial massage will be performed on the legs, arms and the back.
intervention.arm_group_label: Superficial Massage and Water immersion in room temperature

intervention.description: The intervention group will receive 12 minutes of cold water immersion at 14±1°C and shoulder level.
intervention.arm_group_label: Deep massage and Cold water immersion

intervention.description: The comparator group will receive 12 minutes of water immersion at 27±1°C and shoulder level.
intervention.arm_group_label: Superficial Massage and Water immersion in room temperature

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- male and female athletes
- between 12 and 20 years old
- train regularly at the swimming teams of the 4th Region of the State of São Paulo
- swimming practice of two years or more
Exclusion Criteria:
- drugs or alcohol consumption
- use of tobacco or anti-inflammatory drugs/painkillers less than 24 hours before the test
- anemia
- inflammatory process
- diabetes
- cardiovascular disease
- episodes of muscle-tendon or osteoarticular injury in the last six months

overall_official.affiliation: University of São Paulo State, UNESP

patient_data.ipd_description: The individual participant data will not be shared because they belong to a competitive team and most of the participants have less than 18 years old
